thread.title: Marte's homer in 12th inning lifts Pirates over Reds 6-4
thread.title_full: Marte's homer in 12th inning lifts Pirates over Reds 6-4

author: JOHN PERROTTO
title: Marte's homer in 12th inning lifts Pirates over Reds 6-4
text:
Keith Srakocic Marte's homer in 12th inning lifts Pirates over Reds 6-4 
Cincinnati Reds' Tyler Holt, bottom, dives for second on a steal as Pittsburgh Pirates shortstop Jordy Mercer hops over him as he tries to catch the throw from catcher Francisco Cervelli in the fourth inning of a baseball game, Friday, Oct. 2, 2015, in Pittsburgh. Holt went to third on the throw. (AP Photo/Keith Srakocic) Keith Srakocic Marte's homer in 12th inning lifts Pirates over Reds 6-4 
Pittsburgh Pirates starter Francisco Liriano pitches against the Cincinnati Reds in the first inning of a baseball game, Friday, Oct. 2, 2015, in Pittsburgh. (AP Photo/Keith Srakocic) Keith Srakocic Marte's homer in 12th inning lifts Pirates over Reds 6-4 
Cincinnati Reds starter Keyvius Sampson throws against the Pittsburgh Pirates in the first inning of a baseball game, Friday, Oct. 2, 2015, in Pittsburgh. (AP Photo/Keith Srakocic) Keith Srakocic Marte's homer in 12th inning lifts Pirates over Reds 6-4 
Cincinnati Reds third baseman Todd Frazier blows on his hands as he plays in the first inning of a baseball game against the Pittsburgh Pirates, Friday, Oct. 2, 2015, in Pittsburgh. Temperatures were hovering at the 50 degree mark and expected to drop into the 40's during the game. (AP Photo/Keith Srakocic) Keith Srakocic Marte's homer in 12th inning lifts Pirates over Reds 6-4 
Cincinnati Reds' Tyler Holt, right, dives for second on a steal as Pittsburgh Pirates shortstop Jordy Mercer leaps to reach the throw from catcher Francisco Cervelli in the fourth inning of a baseball game, Friday, Oct. 2, 2015, in Pittsburgh. Holt went to third on the throw. (AP Photo/Keith Srakocic) Keith Srakocic Marte's homer in 12th inning lifts Pirates over Reds 6-4 
Pittsburgh Pirates second baseman Neil Walker hits the dirt after diving for a line drive by Cincinnati Reds' Jay Bruce in the third inning of a baseball game, Friday, Oct. 2, 2015, in Pittsburgh. Bruce drove in Joey Votto with the hit. (AP Photo/Keith Srakocic) Keith Srakocic Marte's homer in 12th inning lifts Pirates over Reds 6-4 
Cincinnati Reds' Joey Votto, left, scores from second behind Pittsburgh Pirates catcher Francisco Cervelli on a double by Jay Bruce in the third inning of a baseball game, Friday, Oct. 2, 2015, in Pittsburgh. (AP Photo/Keith Srakocic) Posted: Friday, October 2, 2015 8:59 pm Marte's homer in 12th inning lifts Pirates over Reds 6-4 Associated Press | 
PITTSBURGH (AP) â€” Starling Marte's two-run homer in the bottom of the 12th inning gave the Pittsburgh Pirates a 6-4 victory over Cincinnati on Friday night, extending the Reds' losing streak to 13 games. 
The Pirates (97-63) maintained a two-game lead over the Chicago Cubs for home-field advantage Wednesday night in the NL wild-card game. Pittsburgh can ensure the game is at PNC Park with a win in either of its two remaining games or one Cubs loss in Milwaukee.
